children.text: When it comes to handbags, there are a variety of styles available to choose from. Each type of handbag has its unique design, purpose, and functionality. In this section, we will discuss some of the most popular types of handbags.
Tote Bags

Tote bags are large, spacious bags with open tops and two shoulder straps. They are perfect for carrying everyday essentials, such as books, laptops, and groceries. Tote bags come in a variety of materials, including canvas, leather, and nylon.
Crossbody Bags

Crossbody bags are designed to be worn across the body, with a long strap that can be adjusted to fit comfortably. They are perfect for when you need to be hands-free, such as when traveling or running errands. Crossbody bags come in a variety of sizes and materials, from small leather bags to larger canvas bags.
Clutch Bags

Clutch bags are small, handheld bags that are perfect for formal occasions. They are designed to be carried in the hand or tucked under the arm and come in a variety of materials, including leather, satin, and velvet.
Shoulder Bags
Shoulder bags are designed to be worn over the shoulder, with a single strap or two straps. They are perfect for everyday use and come in a variety of materials, including leather, canvas, and suede.
Satchel Bags

Satchel bags are medium-sized bags with a structured shape and a top handle. They are perfect for carrying everyday essentials, such as a wallet, phone, and keys. Satchel bags come in a variety of materials, including leather, suede, and canvas.

metadata.description: When it comes to handbags, there are a variety of styles available to choose from. Each type of handbag has its unique design, purpose, and functionality. In this section, we will discuss some of the most popular types of handbags.

children.text: High Top Sneakers:
While it’s not entirely possible (to my knowledge) to trace high-tops back to the very first pair, it’s believed that they started to gain traction in 1917 when Converse released the
Chuck Taylor All Star
Slip-On Sneakers:
Laces? Who’s got time for them anymore? In an age where there’s a million and one things to remember, it can be a nice treat to slip on your kicks and go. Easy to style and forever stylish
Synthetic Sneakers:

There’s no denying it, everything we do can have an impact on the environment. From the food we buy to the clothes on our backs, it all has the potential to damage the world we call home. Which is why synthetic sneakers can be a fantastic eco-friendly addition to our collection.
Athletic sneakers:

If you’ve not already noticed, the athleisure trend is huge. What was once kept for the gym has now become an everyday clothing choice for men of all occupations and sporting preferences. And it’s the same for sneakers—making them an essential addition to any wardrobe, whether you’re a gym goer or couch sitter.

children.text: Banaras is a major textile hub that caters the needs of both the local and international markets. One simply cannot miss the Jamdani and brocades of Banaras. The silk Jamdani or the ‘figured muslin’ is a technical variety of brocade traditionally woven in Banaras. It may be considered to be one of the finest products to come out of the Banarasi loom. Here silk fabric is brocaded with cotton and rarely with zari threads.

Jamdani is woven by transfixing the pattern thread between a varying number of warp threads in proportion to the size of the design, then throwing the shuttle to pass the regular weft. By repeating this process, where in the size and placing of the cut-thread is in accordance with the character of the pattern, the Jamdani weaver produces an array of intricate designs.

Jamdani is woven by transfixing the pattern thread between a varying number of warp threads in proportion to the size of the design, then throwing the shuttle to pass the regular weft. By repeating this process, where in the size and placing of the cut-thread is in accordance with the character of the pattern, the Jamdani weaver produces an array of intricate designs.

children.text: Embroidery is the craft of decorating fabric or other materials using a needle to apply thread or yarn. The word embroidery comes from the French word
broderie
, meaning embellishment

In various forms, embroidery has existed since the production of fabric. While embroidery is practiced across the world, its origin stems from China and the Near East. Early embroidery can actually be traced back to Cro-Magnon days or 30,000 B.C. Archeological finds from this time period reveals fossilized remains of heavily hand-stitched and decorated clothing.

Other early examples of embroidery are found in China dating to the Warring States period between 5th and 3rd century B.C. In Sweden, the earliest finds of embroidery are from a period known as the Viking Age, around the 9th and 10th centuries. Around the year 1000, the practice of embroidery began to rise in Europe with the growth of the Christian church and royalty gaining power. Richly decorated garments and ornaments in the form of wall hangings and tablecloths were commissioned to display power and wealth.

Moreover, embroidery was important and in the Medieval Islamic world because it was a sign of high social status in Muslim societies. In cities such as Damascus, Istanbul, and Cairo, embroidery could be found on items such as handkerchiefs, flags, uniforms, robes, horse trappings, pouches, and covers.

Later, in 18th century England and its colonies, embroidery was a skill marking a girl’s passage into womanhood as well as conveying rank and social standing. Soon after, however, the development of the embroidery machine and mass production came about in stages during the Industrial Revolution. The earliest machine embroidery, found in France in the mid-1800s, utilized a combination of machine looms and hand embroidery

search.search_summary: Embroidery is the craft of decorating fabric or other materials using a needle to apply thread or yarn. The word embroidery comes from the French word broderie, meaning embellishment. In various forms, embroidery has existed since the production of fabric

children.text: Gandhi adopted Khadi as a political iconography in protest against British mill-made cotton. In the 21st century, Gandhi’s anti-Colonial Swadeshi politics are garnished with the ethos of sustainability, dressed with notions of handmade luxury, and marketed as the beacon of hope to uplift the indigenous weavers of India

Looms operated with the aid of electric power for the manufacturing of cloth are called as Powerlooms whereas the Handlooms are looms operated without aid of power. The elite-castes owned powerloom sector roughly accounts for 60% of fabric production in India whereas the oppressed-castes dominated the handloom sector despite employing a whopping 11 million indigenous artisans, contributes to 15% of fabric production.  While the Government of India protects the interests of the handloom sector from the encroachment of the powerloom industry by way of reserving certain specifications for exclusive production by handlooms (Handlooms Reservation of Articles for Production Act, 1985), the need to nurture powerloom industries were also addressed simultaneously by the state.

Small scale industries are scattered and largely supported by individuals (and immediate family) unlike the powerloom mills operated in larger scales. Loss of eyesight due to inadequate lighting conditions is alarmingly common among handloom weavers.

blt51dac92b6381956a.title: Perfect Tote Bag for Weekend Getaways

children.text: When it comes to packing for a weekend getaway, one accessory can make all the difference— the tote bag. Versatile, stylish and practical, the right tote bag can enhance your travel experience in ways you might not have considered. However, finding the ideal tote bag for your weekend escapades can be a bit of a treasure hunt.
Size Matters

The size of your tote bag will determine how much you can carry, and it’s crucial to strike the right balance. Too small, and you’ll find yourself struggling to fit all your essentials; too large, and you might end up with a cumbersome bag that’s difficult to manage.
Material Magic

The material of your tote bag plays a significant role in both its durability and style. Canvas tote bags are a popular choice for their sturdiness and casual charm, making them ideal for beach getaways or laid-back weekends. Leather totes, on the other hand, exude luxury and sophistication, making them perfect for a more upscale escape.
Strap It Right
The way your tote bag’s straps are designed can impact your comfort and convenience during your trip. Opt for tote bags with sturdy, comfortable shoulder straps for easy carrying.
Compartments and Pockets

When you’re on the go, organisation is key. Look for tote bags with interior pockets or compartments to keep your belongings neatly sorted. A zippered pocket for valuables like your phone, wallet or passport can add an extra layer of security. Exterior pockets can also come in handy for quick access to items like a water bottle or travel documents.
Style and Aesthetics
While functionality is paramount, don’t forget about style. Your tote bag should reflect your personal taste and complement your travel outfits. Consider the colour and design

children.text: From cosy plaid shirts and black slip midi skirts, get inspired by this year’s latest fall clothing trends that’ll have you looking as cute as a pumpkin spice latte.
No matter if it’s for lunch with a date or gathering friends for movie night – there are endless opportunities for rocking this season’s most fashionable trends!
Plaid Shirts

Fall wouldn’t be fall without plaid shirts! With their classic appeal, they match any pair of jeans you own. Plaid shirts add the perfect autumn touch and can even pair nicely with jackets for an eye-catching ensemble. No matter the occasion or look you desire, there’s bound to be one out there that speaks to your personality!
Sweaters

Are you in search of a cosy yet casual outfit to keep you warm this winter? Sweaters offer the ideal solution, offering an abundance of designs, styles, and materials to choose from – with neutrals like khaki and grey as well as warm fall hues like burgundy, plum, hunter green, navy blue, oatmeal brown, and rust!
Chambray Shirts
Are you in search of an easy yet casual outfit idea? Try a chambray shirt!

Originally used by farmers to work, its lightweight cotton material shares many similarities with denim, yet is more comfortable and easier to care for, releasing odors more efficiently than its denim counterpart. Pair yours with jeans, corduroys, or even skirts for a smart yet relaxed look!
Skirts
Finding the ideal fall outfits involves creating the ideal balance of trendy and classic styles.
Pairing a trendy sweater with jeans or leggings can give an effortless yet chic look, while pairing a plaid skirt with a fitted shirt and boots elevates any ensemble for the season.

blt15c0b5cfe8319b76.title: Tips to Use Dyed Fabric This Festival Season

children.text: As the festival season approaches, the allure of beautifully dyed fabric beckons those with a passion for crafting their own unique outfits. They are not just a piece of cloth but a canvas waiting for your creativity to take centre stage. So, for those who love to tailor-make their festival attire, here are some tips to make the most of dyed fabric and craft stunning outfits that will leave a lasting impression.
Choose Your Colours Wisely

They come in a kaleidoscope of colours, so start by choosing hues that resonate with the festival’s spirit and your personal style. Bold and vibrant colours like deep blues, rich reds, and striking purples are often festival favourites. Consider the festival’s theme and your skin tone when selecting your fabric’s colour palette. Experiment with complementary or contrasting colours to create eye-catching combinations.
Opt for Unique Patterns

Dyed fabrics offer a wide range of patterns, from tie-dye and batik to ombre and Shibori. These patterns can add depth and character to your festival attire. For a bohemian vibe, go for tie-dye or Shibori patterns that evoke a sense of free-spiritedness. Batik, with its intricate designs, can bring a touch of sophistication to your festival outfit. Choose a pattern that resonates with your personality and the festival’s ambience.
Mix and Match Fabrics

Don’t limit yourself to a single type of fabric. Mixing and matching different textures and materials can create visually exciting outfits. For instance, pair a tie-dye cotton top with a flowing silk skirt for a contrasting yet harmonious look. The combination of textures can add depth and make your outfit stand out. Just ensure that the fabrics complement each other in terms of colour and style.

search.search_title: Tips to Use Dyed Fabric This Festival Season
search.search_summary: As the festival season approaches, the allure of beautifully dyed fabric beckons those with a passion for crafting their own unique outfits. They are not just a piece of cloth but a canvas waiting for your creativity to take centre stage.
